conclusion: Analyze the given diagram and the relationship between the acceleration of objects A and B as a function of time.
The diagram shows a graph with two lines representing the acceleration of objects A and B over time.
The points of interest are at time t1 and t2.
The graph shows that the acceleration of both objects increases linearly with time.
The acceleration of both objects is proportional to the time elapsed.
The objects start moving simultaneously, the initial velocity of both objects is the same.
At time t1, the velocity of both objects is the same.
Using the given t2 = 2t1, determine the relationship between the time t1 and t2.
Since the acceleration is constant, the velocity of both objects will be the same at t1 and t2.
Since the velocity of both objects is the same at t1, they will have the same velocity at t1.
Conclude that at time t1, the two objects have the same velocity.
